info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 11:05PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GRANT COUNTY THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1104 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elwood, or 8 miles southwest of Fairmount, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Gas City, Upland, Fairmount, Jonesboro, Fowlerton, Hackleman, Michaelsville, and Radley. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 254 and 258. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
